title: Project 2
text:
Project Description
I conducted a study on a virtual island to see the effects of various factors on cognition. I studied the effects of drug use, exercise, gender, and diet on cognition. I then conducted a two-way ANOVA to determine if there was a significant difference before and after the treatments were administered. I created a multiple linear regression model to analyze the significant variables.


Results
I found that there was a significant difference before and after the treatments were administered. I determined the most significant factors on cognition to be diet, gender, and the interaction between diet and gender.



Diagnostic Plots of Final Model





Boxplots of Interaction between Diet and Gender on Cognition

title: Project 1
text:
Project Description
I worked with a team to analyze a dataset containing various variables for different countries and their life expectancy. We created a multiple linear regression model in R to determine what factors most contributed to life expectancy. We also created plots in R to display our model and the data.


Results
Through our analysis, we found the most significant factors that impact life expectancy to be alcohol use, BMI, GDP, education, and Population.



Diagnostic Plots of Our Model





Histograms of Significant Variables

title: Project 3
text:
Project Description
I worked with a team to analyze a dataset on obesity and create a model to predict the obesity status of individuals. We created various models to accurately predict obesity.


Results
Out of the models we created, we found the most accurate one to be a random forest model with feature importance. We used 16 variables from the dataset in our model. They were Race, Height, Age, FAF, MTRANS, CH2O, family_history_with_overweight, CALC, TUE, FCVC, NCP, CAEC, FAVC, Gender, SCC, and ever_married.



Density Plot





Mean Decrease in Accuracy for the Variables
